samples.question: What is your favorite color?
samples.transcript: Well, I do not think I have a specific favorite color. I practice art, so I have learned myself I have trained myself to fall in love with like a whole spectrum of color, you know. but I am actually quite bad at coloring. So, I think that normally for my color picks when I do art, I just go for very simple color combinations like complimentary for example. Okay.

So, I think that normally for my color picks when I do art, I just go for very simple color combinations like complimentary for example. Okay.

So, I think that normally for my color picks when I do art, I just go for very simple color combinations like complimentary for example.

samples.question: So, do you usually wear clothes in your favorite color?
samples.transcript: For clothing, that is a different story because my skin tone is kind of dark. So, I have to specifically go for colors that kind of flatter it. So, for me, it would be very muted colors.
samples.transcript_original: Uh, for clothing, that's a different story because my skin tone is kind of dark. So, I have to specifically go for colors that kind of flatter it. So, for me, it would be very muted colors.

samples.question: I do not usually go for vibrant ones because it also does not suit my vibe, right?

samples.question: So are there any colors that have a special meaning in your country?
samples.transcript: I mean the obvious answer would be red. you would see that ubiquitously in Ted holiday and in very you know jubilant occasions of Vietnam like wedding ceremonies or other celebrations you know. I think red kind of you know in Vietnamese culture means something like not just jubilation but also joy and prosperity. So that is why it is like a very common pick for those occasions. Yeah. Okay.

samples.question: So do you think different types of people like different colors?
samples.transcript: That is a pretty interesting one. I have never really thought about that. I I think people like naturally gravitate towards different colors based on like historically how they have like get exposed to them, you know. for example, if someone you know as a child and as someone as a child they learned art and they tended to use a very vibrant colors, maybe they would grow up and picking those colors more. But if someone has gone through like a very I would say difficult period in their lives then maybe they would have the tendency to pick more muted or like you know just monotone colors just to reflect their their minds a bit better. Yeah. Okay.

samples.question: So, do you think it is easy to take good photographs?
samples.transcript: I mean, as an artist, I kind of tempted to say that it is because, you know, that is kind of this tension between artists who paint pictures and photo photographers who just take photos. That is like we are the people who are creating true art, not them. But you know after trying out photo photography for like for a decent amount of time I have gotten my fair share of experience in that I did realize that you know photography also comes with all the sophistication that it comes with of painting. You still have to prepare for the lighting. You still have to make sure the composition is right.
samples.transcript_original: Um, I mean, as an artist, I kind of tempted to say that it is because, you know, that's kind of this tension between artists who paint pictures and photo photographers who just take photos. samples.question: Not to mention that you also have to like pay very acute attention to the technical details like choosing the right lens for the shoot that you want to take, right?
samples.transcript: And when you take photographs, you just do not have that that leeway with the scene. You know, as an artist, you can set up the scene however you want. Like basically pull it out an image from your head, but for photography, you have to wait for the right moment. And that is actually what makes street photography so fascinating to me, you know, because you always have to be there, be present at the moment, and you have to make sure that your camera is ready when there is an interesting snap.

samples.question: So, what are the pros and cons of digital photography?
samples.transcript: All right. So, I think that nowadays the line between digital photography and the more traditional method to produce photos have been kind of blurred. because nowadays we have a lot of softwares that allow us kind of facilitate the process for us to create any kind of look that we wish for our photos. You can like set up a more traditional lighting setting in Adobe Lightroom and you can you know just retouch a photo however you like. as long as you are aware of the you know the potential artificial quality that might come with overediting a photo then I think you should be fine. So that is the pros of digital photography that is that you have a lot of avenue for editing your photos nowadays.
samples.transcript_original: All right. So, I think that nowadays the line between digital photography and the more traditional method to produce photos have been kind of blurred. uh because nowadays we have a lot of softwares uh that allow us kind of facilitate the process for us to create any kind of look that we wish for our photos. You can like set up a more traditional lighting setting in Adobe Lightroom and you can you know just retouch a photo however you like. Uh as long as you are aware of the um you know the potential artificial quality that might come with overediting a photo then I think you should be fine. So that's the pros of digital photography that is that you have a lot of avenue uh for editing your photos nowadays.
samples.transcript_cleaned: All right. samples.question: So, should people share your photographs of themselves online?
samples.transcript: I think that they have every right to do that. Really, I do not think there is a law that ban people from sharing photographs of themselves online. Well, maybe say for the cases when they infringe or violate some, you know, some rules, terms and conditions of the platform they are going to be posting photos on. I think that it is something that should be encouraged really because it not only promotes bodily positivity.

I think that it's something that should be encouraged really because um it not only promotes bodily positivity.

samples.question: What can an image be worth a thousand words?
samples.transcript: Well this is when when right okay so worth a thousand words. this is actually really tricky. samples.question: Do you live in a house or an apartment?
samples.transcript: I live in an apartment and, it is a townhouse. Okay.
samples.transcript_original: I live in an apartment and, uh, it is a townhouse. Okay.

samples.question: Can you describe your apartment?
samples.transcript: Sure. So, as I said, this is called a townhouse and it has two floors. It has one basement. It has three bedrooms, two washrooms, a living space, and a kitchen. Okay.
